Description: Glazed composition amuletic figure of Hapy: baboon-headed Hapy, mummiform and in long wig, is represented in the round against a back plaque, all made from pale turquoise green glazed composition. He holds against his body two long folded cloths, one of them coloured red. The piece is pierced at all four corners for attachment to mummy wrappings. The presentation of different coloured linen bands was an essential part of the funerary ritual.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: 'Egyptian Treasures' [exhibition catalogue] (Shanghai, 1999), 148-150 No 45; C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994), p.46.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 2000 / Egyptian Treasures from the British Museum (p.124)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Marion Whiteford Acworth JP
